info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 3:22PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Yavapai County southeast of Yarnell through 400 PM MST... At 321 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Yarnell, or 14 miles north of Wickenburg, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, penny size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Localized flooding is possible. Locations impacted include... Congress, Yarnell and Glen Ilah. This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 258 and 279. State Route 71 between mile markers 107 and 109. Highway 93 between mile markers 193 and 196. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
